snippet: Shoppers no longer have to pay New York State sales tax on clothing and footwear items under $110, but few local jurisdictions have similar exemptions.
abstract: Shoppers are pleasantly surprised when New York State reinstates its sales-tax exemption on clothing and footwear items costing less than $110; New York has periodically suspended the exemption, first enacted in 2000, to balance state budget.
lead_paragraph: Shoppers no longer have to pay New York State sales tax on clothing and footwear items under $110, but few local jurisdictions have similar exemptions.

headline.seo: New York State Reinstates Sales Tax Exemption for Clothing and Footwear
headline.main: For Some New York Shoppers, No More State Sales Tax
headline.print_headline: For Some New York Shoppers, No More State Sales Tax
